description: Iran’s economy is likely to be a major election issue, as the country faces crippling international sanctions, 30 percent unemployment, and soaring inflation.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Friday, June 14, 2013
contentencoded:
Voters in Iran head to the polls today to pick a new president. Iran’s economy is likely to be a major issue, as the country faces crippling international sanctions, 30 percent unemployment, and soaring inflation.

Saeed Barzin, Iran analyst for the BBC's Persian Service, joins Marketplace Morning Report host David Brancaccio to discuss.
title: Economy takes center stage in Iran election
